conclusion: A transformer with two secondary coils has a primary coil with n1 = 100 turns, connected to a circuit with a voltage of U1 = 220V.
Two appliances, '6 V 20 W' and '110 V 60 W,' are connected to the two secondary coils respectively.
The image shows a transformer with primary coil labeled n1 and secondary coils labeled n2 and n3, with voltages U2 and U3 respectively.
Calculate current for first secondary coil: I = P/V = 20 W / 6 V = 10/3 A.
Calculate turns ratio for first secondary coil: n1/n2 = U1/U2 = 220 V / 6 V = 36.67.
Calculate turns for first secondary coil: n2 = n1 * (U2/U1) = 100 * (6/220) = 2.73 turns.
Calculate current for second secondary coil: I = P/V = 60 W / 110 V = 6/11 A.
Calculate turns ratio for second secondary coil: n1/n3 = U1/U3 = 220 V / 110 V = 2.
Calculate turns for second secondary coil: n3 = n1 * (U3/U1) = 100 * (110/220) = 50 turns.
The input current in the primary coil is 0.364 A.
